channel.title: Intel building DRM into new processors
channel.description:
http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9202961/Intel_s_upcoming_Core_chips_to_secure_streaming_movies
Intel on Monday said that it was building a hardware security layer in its next-generation Core chips to prevent streaming movies from being copied. The chip feature, called Insider, includes an end-to-end protection layer and management feature to unlock high-definition movies from online streaming services, said Karen Regis, consumer Consumer Client Marketing Manager at Intel.
WTF. I'll stick with my AMD thanks.

item.title: Intel building DRM into new processors
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Actually there is a free (ly distributable) legal MP3 codec for linux now.

But there wasn’t for a long time. And it’s still very much not an open format.

Read full topic

item.title: Intel building DRM into new processors
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:21, topic:376791”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=472711.msg3458203#msg3458203 date=1294227050]
Though I do find his calling of MP3 an open format pretty fucking laughable.
[/quote]
You know what he means though. Every idiot and his dog has access to software that encodes/decodes mp3.[/quote]

Except the not so every idiot and his dog who uses a redhat distro which doesn’t include mp3 in the default install for licensing reasons.

Read full topic

item.title: Intel building DRM into new processors
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

They’re DRM free now, because Steve Jobs doesn’t like DRM and iTunes managed to get enough market share to be able to pressure the music studios into removing it.

Apple Newsroom

Newsroom

Apple Newsroom is the source for news about Apple. Read press releases, get updates, watch video and download images.

item.title: Intel building DRM into new processors
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Mopman:

itunes, the drm free music store, you mean?

They’re DRM free now, because they learnt the lesson the hard way.
Sooner or later companies learn that people aren’t going to buy a product from them that is highly restricted in its use when Joe Pirate has told them that sometorrentsite.com exists and provides untainted high quality DVD/Blu-ray rips.

Read full topic

item.title: Intel building DRM into new processors
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:13, topic:376791”]and 90% of the world wont have it and the content will be seen by none

thus the world became a better place when the corporations realised DRM is excessively restrictive[/quote]
I agree. Companies are going to learn their place the hard way if they think they can take a hard line on piracy at the expense of regular users.

Case in point would be Itunes.

item.title: Intel building DRM into new processors
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Computerworld

Intel's upcoming Core chips to secure streaming movies

Intel on Monday said that it was building a hardware security layer in its next-generation Core chips to prevent streaming movies from being copied.

Intel on Monday said that it was building a hardware security layer in its next-generation Core chips to prevent streaming movies from being copied.

The chip feature, called Insider, includes an end-to-end protection layer and management feature to unlock high-definition movies from online streaming services, said Karen Regis, consumer Consumer Client Marketing Manager at Intel.

WTF. I’ll stick with my AMD thanks.

Read full topic
